pageContext.claim: “And we will live by the timeless words of our national motto, In God we Trust. In God we -- you know, they wanted to take the word God out of their pledge of allegiance. You saw that. And I watched, and I said, 'Oh, they must have made a typo.' Uh, they didn't have in God, they didn't have God, they took the word God out. I said must, and then when I watched it a second time, same thing happened. I said, 'This is serious.' And then, our country got very angry, and it was incredible how quickly God got put back into, right? Got put back. Pledge of allegiance.”
pageContext.analysis: Actually, the pledge was recited in full each night of the convention. The words “under God” were omitted at the start of daytime meetings for two caucuses, though.
